Course Name: GRADUATE RESEARCH AND WRITING IN GERMAN
Description:
Individual instruction and assistance with problems encountered in academic research and writing in German.
 Required of all graduate students in their first semester of graduate work.
Students apply linguistic and communication science concepts to case studies of language mediation.
(Repeatable for credit)Topic announced in schedule of classes.

Thesis students must register for a total of 6 hours, 2 to 6 hours in a single semester distributed over several
 semesters if desired.

Translating documents from a variety of literary and cultural sources, including literature, expository and
 journalistic prose, scholarly treatises and essays. Translation into German will also be emphasized.

An introduction to methods and resources for the translation of commercial, economic, financial, legal,
 diplomatic and governmental documents.

An introduction to methods and resources for the translation of scientific, technical, industrial and medical
 documents.
Thesis students must continue registration each semester until all degree requirements are met.
